description.text: Indicates the location of the global application settings. This is typically a shared location on the application server.
Indicates if the style descriptions are to be updated if the style already exists. The default is false.
Designates that the stock values in the file are ending stock values (EOD or EOW) and will be rolled to beginning stock (BOD or BOW) values.
'True' indicates that the process is to automatically add new items to the hierarchy. 'False' indicates the items should be rejected.

This option identifies that the process is to generate rollup items for the rollup process to create store weekly history values from daily values. The rollup process must then be run with the 'posting' option to complete the rollup process.

This option identifies that the process is to generate rollup items for the rollup process to aggregate store daily history values up the hierarchy. The rollup process must then be run with the 'posting' option to complete the rollup process.

This option identifies that the process is to generate rollup items for the rollup process to aggregate store weekly history and forecast values up the hierarchy. The rollup process must then be run with the 'posting' option to complete the rollup process.

This option identifies that the process is to generate rollup items for the rollup process to aggregate store weekly history and forecast values to chain values. The rollup process must then be run with the 'posting' option to complete the rollup process.

This option identifies that the process is to generate rollup items for the rollup process to aggregate chain weekly history and forecast values up the hierarchy. The rollup process must then be run with the 'posting' option to complete the rollup process.

This option identifies that the process is to generate rollup items for the rollup process to aggregate intransit values up the hierarchy. The rollup process must then be run with the 'posting' option to complete the rollup process.
Indicates the 'environment' for the specific installation. Examples are 'production', 'test', and 'acceptance'. This setting must be unique for each installation of the application.

Indicates the IP Address and port where the Control Server is listening. The Control Server will return a Client, Store, Hierarchy, and Application Server where remote sessions can be created. If this key is not assigned, all sessions will be created locally (in the address space of the client).
'True' indicates the Session is to be created locally. 'False' indicates the Session is remote.
This is the file path the Header Release XML will be written to.

Indicates the transaction file processing order and is based upon the filed modified date. Valid options are 'FIFO', 'FILO' and 'Default'. Default = 'Default'. 'Default' means file order is not significant.

Indicates the transaction file processing order and is based upon the filed modified date. Valid options are 'FIFO', 'FILO' and 'Default'. Default = 'FIFO'. 'Default' means file order is not significant.
This is the trigger file's extension that will be created for a Header Release. Do not specify '.'. If not specified, trigger file will not be created.
Identifies if the client to be automatically upgraded if a different version if found at the AutoUpgradePath.
Identifies the network path to locate the client to be used for the upgrade. The Windows user will need at least read authority to this location.
Identifies the path and name for the client upgrade log. The default is C:\Logility\RO\upgrade.log.
Indicates the character to use to separate non-XML input transactions.

Identifies the format of the output file. The options are XML or CSV. If CSV is selected, then the delimiter character (comma, tilde, etc.) and the file suffix must be specified. The file suffix for and XML file is '.xml'. The default is 'CSV'.
Identifies the delimiter to use in the CSV format to separate the fields. The default is ','.
Identifies the characters to use in the suffix of the csv file. The default is 'csv'.
Identifies the format of dates that are exported. The options are Calendar and Fiscal. The default is Fiscal.
Identifies if values are to be exported prior to being initialized with the forecast computations. The default is False.
Identifies if values are to be excluded from being exporteddue to zero values. The default is False.
Identifies the location of the output files. The default is C:\Logility\RO\MID Advanced Allocation for SQL Server\ExportOutput.
Identifies if a date stamp is to be added to the file name. The default is False.
Identifies if a time stamp is to be added to the file name. The default is False.
Identifies if the data is to be split by specific data criteria. The options are None, Merchandise, and NumberOfEntries. The default is None.
Identifies the number of rows by which to split a file if the Export_SplitFiles is set to NumberOfEntries. The default is 10000.

Identifies if the Export_SplitFiles option is merchandise, then a separate file will be created for each merchandise node to be exported. This specification allows multiple export processes to run concurrently, one per node. This is useful to improve performance in terms of overall run time. The default is 10.

Identifies if the process will generate a 'flag' file which is an empty file whose name is the same as the export file name, suffixed with the suffix specified. The purpose of this feature is to allow creation of 'trigger' files to instruct other processes monitoring this folder that a file exists. The default is False.
Identifies the suffix to use if Export_CreateFlagFile is set to True. The default is 'flg'
Identifies if the process is to create an end file which signifies that all values have been output. The default is False.
Identifies the suffix to use for the end file if Export_CreateEndFile is set to True. The default is 'end'.
The number of days to keep audit history.
The number of days to keep completed schedule history.

This is a performance tuning option. 'True' indicates the Input file can be serialized during loading. 'False' indicates the InputFile will be read a field at a time. This option should only be set to 'True' if the machine where the job is executing has twice the available memory as the size of the input file.
This option identifies whether allocation header IDs are present in the input transactions.
Indicates the application user ID for non-client processes to use when logging into the application.
Indicates the password for the User.
The directory and name of the Size Constraints input transactions
This option identifies whether size codes are being sent in the input transactions
The directory and name of the size curve (attach to stores) input transactions
The directory and name of the size curve group input transactions
The path to the report file.
The directory and name of the file where exceptions are to be written
Identifies the process is to create components if a modify action is requested and the component does not exist
The directory and name of the input transactions. The file name can be overridden using an input argument.
Indicates a list of port(s) where the Store Server(s) are listening. It is recommended that only a single Store Server is used.
Indicates a list of port(s) where the Hierarchy Server(s) are listening. It is recommended that only a single the Hierarchy Server is used.
Indicates a list of port(s) where the Application Server(s) are listening.
Indicates a list of port(s) where the Scheduler Server(s) are listening. It is recommended that only a single Scheduler Server is used.
The amount of time in milliseconds between passes through the schedule.
The amount of time in milliseconds before checking for termination while waiting in the scan interval.
The style of window for the started processes. Can be 'Normal', 'Maximized', 'Minimized', or 'Hidden'. Will not apply when run as a service.
The location of the executable for forecaset
The location of the executable for allocate
The location of the executable for rollup
The location of the executable for purge
The location of the executable for relieve intransit
The location of the executable for color codes load
The location of the executable for header Reconcile
The location of the executable for header load
The location of the executable for hierarchy load
The location of the executable for history plan
The location of the executable for size codes load
The location of the executable for size curve load
The location of the executable for store load
The location of the executable for size constraints load
The location of the executable for computation driver
The location of the executable for push to back stock load
The location of the executable for Batch Comp
Indicates the port where the component is communicating.
The amount of time in milliseconds to hold a read lock on data
The amount of time in milliseconds to hold a write lock on data
Number of seconds between forced garbage collections. If this value is 0, no forced collection will occur.
When true, writes out a log of forecasting details when a forecast is process.
When running local, this is the file path the Monitor Forecast Logs will be written to.
When true, writes out a log of DC Fulfillment details when a DC Fulfillment is process.
This is the file path the DC Fulfillment Logs will be written to.
'True' indicates the message indicating the scheduler service was not found should not be shown. 'False' indicates the message should be displayed.
The database connection string.
The RO Export database connection string.
The file suffix used to terminate the process.
Indicates if characteristics that do not already exist should be added to the system.
Only used by delimited input files. Indicates whether the transactions will use separate records for characteristic values. Default = False.
The number of items to hold in memory. This is used to control memory use.
The number of color and style IDs to hold in memory. This is used to tune performance.
The number of nodes to replace in memory when the CacheSize is hit. This is used to tune performance.
Identifies if the color and size IDs are to be rebuilt when the service starts.
The model to use to determine if computations must be executed after posting.
Identifies the intransit for all stores are to be relieved when a header is relieved.
Identifies if users marked for delete are to be deleted.
The number of days to keep deleted users before they are removed.
Identifies if groups marked for delete are to be deleted.
The Purge Process will attempt to delete empty dynamic store sets.
The number of days to keep deleted groups before they are removed.
Identifies if the process is to clean up data rows with all zeros. Note: This operation will affect the overall run time of the process.
Identifies if the process is to clean up data rows with all variables unlocked. Note: This operation will affect the overall run time of the process.
Identifies the number of items to process in each transaction. This is used to tune performance.
Identifies the number of process to run at a time. This is used to tune performance.
Identifies if a zero value is to be included in averages.
Indicates the database table name for header bulk information.
Indicates the database table name for header pack information.
The location of the file that contains the SQL statement to use retrieve headers to be relieved.
Indicates the folder to write the Relieve Intransit files.
Indicates the name to use for the Relieve Intransit files.
Indicates the number of transactions in a Relieve Intransit file.
Identifies the characters to use in the suffix of the Relieve Intransit file. The default is 'trg'.
Identifies whether a log should be produced.
The location of the Size Day to Week Summary log.
Identifies if the environment setting is to be included in the status area.
The location of the executable for size curve generate
The location of the executable for build packs criteria load
The location of the executable for size day to week summary
Indicates the minimum level of messages that are to be written to the audit file.
Indicates the number of database writes to issue per transaction. This can be used to tune database performance. Use "UNLIMITED" for a single database transaction.
The time (in seconds) to wait for the command to execute. The default is 30 seconds.
The time (in milliseconds) to wait between retry attempts. The default is 2000 (2 seconds).
The number of times to retry a database call before failing the call. This can be set to 0 if you do not want the application to attempt to retry the call.
Indicates if the standard API return codes should be returned instead of the scheduler return codes.
Indicates the number of database writes to issue per audit transaction. This can be used to tune database performance.
The time (in seconds) of audit inactivity before closes database connection. The default is 30 seconds.
Indicates the header characteristic that is defined as the Push to Back-stock comparison date.
Indicates the header characteristic that when set to 'Y' forces the transfer to Back-stock.
Indicates the value in the ForceToBackStockCharacteristic that forces the transfer to Back-stock.
Indicates the folder where input files are located.
Indicates the folder where output files are to be written.
Identifies the characters to use in the suffix of the file
Indicates the number of transactions per output file.
Indicates if delete transactions are to be generated. The default is True
Identifies the characters to use in the suffix of the reclass move file
Identifies the characters to use in the suffix of the reclass delete file
Disables the removal of unused attribute sets
Identifies the number of prior weeks to look for history
Identifies the number of future weeks to look for history
Identifies the number of future weeks to look for forecasts. If 0, forecasts will not be used.
Identifies the number of future weeks to look for intransit
The hostname of the control server, required for Remote System Options.
The Remote System Options port to use on the control server, must be different than the control server port.
The time (in milliseconds) to wait between receiving commands from the control server, required for Remote System Options.
The time (in milliseconds) to wait between receiving commands from the client apps, required for Remote System Options.
The Sell Thru value that identifies a good selling rate. Examples are '.8', and '1.2'.
Indicates the purpose of the RO Web Job Service.
Identifies the machine names and ports (machine:port) of secondary servers separated by semicolon (;)
The list of TCP ports separated by semicolon (;) to be used for RO Web Client communication.
The time (in seconds) before an RO Web Client is considered inactive and shut down.
The location of the RO Web Client executable.
The address of the service host for commumication.
Identifies the file name for the remove transactions generated by the header reconcile process.
Header types to be processed by Header Reconcile. Valid values are 'All' or Any combination of: Receipt, PO, ASN, Dummy, Dropship, Reserve, WorkupTotalBuy, VSW delimited by a comma.
File that contains the list of keys used by the Header Reconcile Process and the Header Load Process to determine matching headers and to create Header IDs.
Indicates the delimiter to use between fields when constructing the header ID.
Indicates the length of the sequence number appended to generated header IDs.
A value of 'True' provides support for generating header IDs for transactions where Header ID is missing.
Identifies the characters to use in the suffix of the remove transactions file
Identifies the time to begin stopping Purge. Format HH:MM AM/PM.
Indicates the folder where graphics files are found.
Indicates the folder where files are found.
The name of the log file.
Indicates the minimum level of messages that are to be written to the log file.
Indicates the folder and name of the log file.
Indicates the minimum level of messages that are to be written to all log files.

install_text.text: Install or maintain a server component(s)
Perform database maintenance or other activities
Recan this machine for installed Logility-RO software
Errors were encountered while starting the services. Check the log for details.
Errors were encountered while stoping the services. Check the log for details.

User selected to configure by IP Address.
Adds the necessary Windows Event Sources

1. Logility - RO Installation and Maintenance Guide\n2. Technical Reference Manual - Chapter 1 Installation\n3. ReadMe.txt
I have read and understand the above statement.\nI confirm that all users are out of the application\n and all processes have been stopped.

I accept the above will be upgraded and \na complete backup was done prior to this action.
I accept the above will be upgraded by this action.

Configuration added. Key {0} in file {1} was added with value {2}.
Encryption error. Key {0} in file {1} was not encrypted. Please reinstall the application.
Based on the registered components, this is an application server.
Based on the registered components, this is an batch server.
Based on the registered components, this is a client machine.
Based on the registered components, this is a new installation.
Unable to establish a connection to the database. It will not be upgraded.
Updating configuration files based on installation options.
Upgrade completed with errors. Review logs.
User has chosen to upgrade all components.
An unsupported version of operating system was found. Installation has been cancelled.
The value of {0} for {1} in {2} was below the minimum and has been overridden to {3}
The value of {0} for {1} in {2} was above the maximum and has been overridden to {3}

help_text.text: Help not set for this item.

Select the option you wish to perform. One-Click Upgrade - upgrade all application components Client - add or maintain client application Server - add or maintain server component Configure - configure application Utilities - perform utilities
Show Details will display installation message details.
Select the client option you wish to perform. Install Client - add new client Installed Client Tasks - perform maintenance on previously installed client

Select the server option you wish to perform. Install Server Component - add new server component. Install Configuration - add new global configuration file (MIDSettings.config) Installed Server Component Tasks - perform maintenance on previously installed server components.
Perform database maintenance, start/stop services or perform other application functions.
Use to scan this machine to identify Logility-RO applications to be maintained by this utility.
Displays all messages produced by this utility.
